intro: Lepidium platypetalum, commonly known as the broad-petaled cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a short, cylindrical siliqua that contains several small, oval seeds.
